resources.string: all copy right reserved by the wave mobile App A
Is a non-profit and non-governmental organization founded in 2004 under
the name of Safe House for Displaced Children. It was just a simple project
housing a number of displaced children in Baghdad. Over time, the project developed
and expanded and became the care of dozens of orphans and displaced children and family
carers. Civilization in 2017 has graduated from this institution more than (270) children,
some of whom were merged with their families (father or mother or brother) and some with alternative
families such as (uncle or uncle or grandfather or any person in the family can sponsor) To meet all
its needs for a period of six months until it stabilizes, Some of them have been employed in one of the
state institutions and then were promoted and cared for for two years until reaching the stage of dependence
on himself as he has no sponsor in addition to that we currently sponsor 52 children directly care in our
institution and care for 70 children indirect care By providing all their needs in exchange for the care of
the family that sponsors them to go out to the street for the purpose of work or begging and continue to study
A team of young aspirants belongs to the Waves initiative that stimulates self-study
The Foundation has four important projects

1- The Iraqi Safe House project for orphans, homeless children and family care workers: It is a project to provide shelter and care for children suffering from neglect, psychological problems, emotional deprivation, physical and sexual exploitation (orphans / displaced persons / family careless). We are working to provide a safe place for them and provide necessary services from health, psychological, educational and cultural services to the stage of discovering, On the right track has been graduated more than (270) children of the project in 14 years and currently we have (60) children from the age of two to seventeen years.

2- The Iraqi House Project Safe Elderly: - The aim of the project is sheltering and caring for the elderly, especially those in the street, where we work to clean them up and provide them with health care and full care by sheltering them in the Iraqi safe house for the elderly. After recovery, they have the ability to take care of themselves. .

3 - Project to ensure orphans by distance: - Through this project, our organization sponsors and ensures orphaned children of both sexes in their homes with their mother or a relative. We provide them with a monthly salary and provide them with all their daily needs in order to complete their studies through continuous follow-up by the project staff. ) Male and female child.

4. The Golden Nest Project:
We have built 6 small supplements for young people who graduate from our institution after they work and who do not have families where we marry them and give them a two year free residence. Then they leave the place to be occupied by another young man after reaching the stage of self-reliance. Now they are family owners and active members of society
